reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was easily found and is only a few minutes drive from the Tunnel terminal. As usual with Premier Inn, reception was helpful and the room was comfortable, modern and a good size. We left too early for breakfast. My only complaint is that the room was too hot (one of our few warm days this summer) and the heating controls could only warm the room and not act as air conditioners. Is it asking too much to have functioning aircon in the rooms? Otherwise a pleasant enough stopover and reasonable value at £72 for the room.
reviews.title: Good overnight stop on way to Channel Tunnel

reviews.text: Very easy to find, parking ample and the restaurant which we used for both dinner and breatfast was excellent. There was 8 of us made up of two families of 4 and we had a family room each. Very comfortable, however, the only issue was that it was a very warm/hot day and evening and there is no way of cooling the room other than a small 8-10 inch fan which really wasnt adequate with 4 hot people in a room. Air conditioning is needed for these occasions otherwise great hotel
reviews.title: Pre Eurotunnel trip

reviews.text: Thought long and hard whether to rate this a 2 or a 3 but on balance it is just about a 3. I stay in quite a few Premier Inns and they are all much better than this. The particular beef I have is the lack of air con. On a summers night the room temperature is just about unbearable. If Premier Inn genuinely want me to have a good night’s sleep then air con for this hotel is a must. Perhaps I should have invoked the good nights guarantee clause to get my money back. Not sure what other hotels are in Folkestone but will certainly look next time. As one other review has said “good enough for a one night’s stay before travelling to France” and I would endorse that, would not want to stay here any longer than that.
reviews.title: Not up to Premier Inns usual standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We usually stay here when visiting family in Folkestone and are always happy with our stay. The hotel has been updated in the last 5 months and now has flat screen tv's on the wall, more plug sockets and a tidier decor even though my husband had a good night sleep but complaint of backache in the morning as the mattress is a little to soft for him. The receptionist was really friendly and helpful. we went for the £22 meal deal which was 3 course dinner and 1 drink and breakfast at Table Table (Brickfield arms). It was busy and we hadn't booked a table but the staff were really friendly and didn't have to wait long. The cooked breakfast was huge and you can eat as much as you like from the continental breakfast and cooked. Parking can be a problem if you get there fairly late as the restaurant can get busy.
reviews.title: Satisfied customer

reviews.text: We only stayed here for one night before we travelled onwards to Paris through the tunnel.
reviews.title: Overnight Stay for the tunnel - Perfect

reviews.text: Another great stay on route to europe.
reviews.title: Always comfortable and reliable

reviews.text: All rooms ver clean and what you would expect. Ideal location for Channel tunnel.
reviews.title: Overnight stop before tunnel crossing

reviews.text: Food in restaurant is OK, and the service is excellent.. WiFi very slow.
reviews.title: Premier Inn Folkestone

reviews.text: Would highly reccomend this hotel as a great overnight stay trvelling to Europe.
reviews.title: Premier Inn Channel Tunnel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was fine though as others have mentioned the room was hot and there was noise both from the main road next to our room and from the alarm clock in the next room which went off at some unearthly hour and woke us up as well as the occupants. There is also very little parking space on a saturday evening when the burger king and the other restuarant are busy so we had to park some distance away from the hotel itself. Not a major inconvenience though, as we did not have much to carry.
reviews.title: Useful Stopover - Would Stay Again

reviews.text: Otherwise it was good. It is easy to find and very close to the M20. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. The hotel was fully booked and one staff member was going out of her way to ring round and try and find a tired traveller a room in another hotel, which impressed us. She went beyond the call of duty. My husband also left his phone in the room. We realised after leaving, rang them on my phone and they immediately sent someone to check under the bed and behind the settee. They rang me back within 10 minutes to say they had found it and we were able to return and collect it. The room itself was very clean, the water hot, the bed comfortable with a choice of pillows, and there was one of the new flat screen TVs that Premier Inn are fitting in all their hotels. if it hadn't been for next door's alarm clock we would have had a very good nights sleep. For us this was just a stopover after arriving on an evening ferry from France, and we would stay here again if travelling cross channel. We did not try the restuarant. We felt it was a little expensive however but there again it was a short notice booking on a bank holiday room so we could not really expect a cheap rate or a bargain price!
reviews.title: Not a plesant stay

reviews.text: People above us were very noisy this hotel needs more sound proofing in the floors be warned.the hotel reception seemed disinterested at our problem and refused to give us our money back.
reviews.title: Restored My Faith in Budget Hotels...

reviews.text: I had a 6 hour car drive the following day and was very tired.
reviews.title: Summer rating- 4 stars in Winter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well if the service was the only mark it would be 5 star , the lovely staff are a credit to the company , but come on Premier Inn pull your socks up and get some Air Con in to the building , yes you ask the staff to keep the curtains closed and you have fans and they were good and well needed....I stayed on sunday 11 August this year which i think must have been the hottest night this year as inside the room was 28'c it was only 20 outside , not sure how that is possible!!!
reviews.title: Nearly very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from the heat it was great . And only 5 minutes from Chanel Tunnel , which is great at 4 AM
reviews.title: Like the refurbishment

reviews.text: This premier inn has recently been refurbished with some slight difference but don,t worry i think it is better! As a woman i appreciate the well lit mirror at the end of the fitment also the hooks on the wall for hanging your long dresses or coats. The bed is still lovely & comfy & the staff friendly. The t.v. is much bigger again an improvement. However still no decaff coffee unless you ask
reviews.title: Another great visit to a very handy Premier Inn Location

reviews.text: We've stayed at Premier Inns all over the Country and also here at the Channel Tunnel twice before. Each time, the stay has been very pleasing although I expect due to its location and popularity, we never get one of their "deals" to stay at this one for a budget price. That said, we still find it good value for money.
reviews.title: Premier Inn Folkstone

reviews.text: Again, on our way to France, we had written beforehand informing them ouf our need for a ground floor room to suit our two young Sons who are both wheelchair users. We had been allocated rooms 5 and 7 for our party (travelling with good friends) which were perfectly located just behind reception.
reviews.title: Good value for money
